definition: only when absolutely essential (idiom); as a last resort
surname Wan
ten thousand/a great number
(negative prefix)/not/no
structural particle: used after a verb (or adjective as main verb), linking it to following phrase indicating effect, degree, possibility etc
to have to/must/ought to/to need to
to obtain/to get/to gain/to catch (a disease)/proper/suitable/proud/contented/to allow/to permit/ready/finished
already/to stop/then/afterwards

sentences.english: As a result, compaction is generally only done when it appears to be necessary.
sentences.chinese: 因此，通常只在萬不得已時才進行壓縮。

sentences.english: The use of antibiotics is permitted only in extremis.
sentences.chinese: 只有在萬不得已的情況下才允許使用抗生素。

sentences.english: You don't want to give away any more of your future 4） profits than you have to.
sentences.chinese: 除非萬不得已，你不會想把更多未來的利潤拱手讓人。

sentences.english: She came to me as a last resort, having been single for a decade.
sentences.chinese: 萬不得已，在單身十年後，她來找我了。

sentences.english: But those are solutions of last resort.
sentences.chinese: 但這些都是萬不得已的解決方案。

sentences.english: Believes a government bailout should only be a last resort.
sentences.chinese: 相信除非萬不得已，不應由政府進行救援。

sentences.english: Don't take this medicine unless it's absolutely necessary.
sentences.chinese: 非萬不得已不要用這種藥。

sentences.english: Side effects of antipyretics , and non-last resort do not.
sentences.chinese: 退熱藥副作用大，非萬不得已不用。

sentences.english: Only as a last resort should you write your own layout manager.
sentences.chinese: 只有在萬不得已時才編寫自己的佈局管理器。

sentences.english: I don't want to break into a $100 note unless I really have to.
sentences.chinese: 除非萬不得已，我不想兌開一張100美元的鈔票。

sentences.english: But I didn't like to go out unless I had to.
sentences.chinese: 除非萬不得已，否則我一點也不想到外面去。

definition: to get sth done once and for all
to have a clear view of things/to adapt to circumstances
to squander money/to spend extravagantly
evil has its retribution (idiom); to suffer the consequences of one's bad deeds/sow the wind and reap the whirlwind (Hosea 8:7)
to play deaf-mute
ill-gotten wealth or gains
to procrastinate/to stall for time/to filibuster
bottomless pit
the gains do not make up for the losses (idiom)
cannot afford/cannot bear the burden
to speak without thinking (idiom)/to blurt sth out
it will cause no end of trouble (idiom)
to speak forcefully and with justice (idiom); to argue with the courage of one's convictions
to think for oneself and act accordingly (idiom); to act on one's own initiative
to contend on strong grounds/to argue strongly for what is right
to work to no avail (idiom)
